00066 class TiXmlBase
00067 {
00068     friend class TiXmlNode;
00069     friend class TiXmlElement;
00070     friend class TiXmlDocument;
00071  
00072   public:
00073     TiXmlBase()                             {}  
00074     virtual ~TiXmlBase()                    {}
00075     
00076     /*  All TinyXml classes can print themselves to a filestream.
00077     */
00078     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth )   = 0;
00079   
00080   protected:
00081     /*  General parsing helper method. Takes a pointer in,
00082         skips all the white space it finds, and returns a pointer
00083         to the first non-whitespace data.
00084     */
00085     static const char* SkipWhiteSpace( const char* p );
00086 
00087     /*  Reads an XML name into the string provided. Returns
00088         a pointer just past the last character of the name, 
00089         or 0 if the function has an error.
00090     */
00091     static const char* ReadName( const char* p, std::string* name );
00092 
00093     enum
00094     {
00095         NO_ERROR = 0,
00096         ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY,
00097         ERROR_PARSING_ELEMENT,
00098         ERROR_FAILED_TO_READ_ELEMENT_NAME,
00099         ERROR_READING_ELEMENT_VALUE,
00100         ERROR_READING_ATTRIBUTES,
00101         ERROR_PARSING_EMPTY,
00102         ERROR_READING_END_TAG,
00103         ERROR_PARSING_UNKNOWN,
00104         ERROR_PARSING_COMMENT,
00105         ERROR_PARSING_DECLARATION,
00106 
00107         ERROR_STRING_COUNT
00108     };
00109     static const char* errorString[ ERROR_STRING_COUNT ];
00110 };

00119 class TiXmlNode : public TiXmlBase
00120 {
00121   public:
00125     enum NodeType 
00126     {
00127         DOCUMENT, ELEMENT, COMMENT, UNKNOWN, TEXT, DECLARATION, TYPECOUNT
00128     };
00129 
00130     virtual ~TiXmlNode();
00131 
00144     const std::string& Value()  const           { return value; }
00145 
00155     void SetValue( const std::string& _value )      { value = _value; }
00156 
00158     TiXmlNode* Parent() const                   { return parent; }
00159 
00160     TiXmlNode* FirstChild() const   { return firstChild; }      
00161     TiXmlNode* FirstChild( const std::string& value ) const;    
00162     
00163     TiXmlNode* LastChild() const    { return lastChild; }       
00164     TiXmlNode* LastChild( const std::string& value ) const;     
00165 
00182     TiXmlNode* IterateChildren( TiXmlNode* previous );
00183 
00185     TiXmlNode* IterateChildren( const std::string& value, TiXmlNode* previous );
00186         
00190     TiXmlNode* InsertEndChild( const TiXmlNode& addThis );                  
00191 
00195     TiXmlNode* InsertBeforeChild( TiXmlNode* beforeThis, const TiXmlNode& addThis );
00196 
00200     TiXmlNode* InsertAfterChild(  TiXmlNode* afterThis, const TiXmlNode& addThis );
00201     
00205     TiXmlNode* ReplaceChild( TiXmlNode* replaceThis, const TiXmlNode& withThis );
00206     
00208     bool RemoveChild( TiXmlNode* removeThis );
00209 
00211     TiXmlNode* PreviousSibling() const          { return prev; }
00212 
00214     TiXmlNode* PreviousSibling( const std::string& ) const;
00215     
00217     TiXmlNode* NextSibling() const              { return next; }
00218 
00220     TiXmlNode* NextSibling( const std::string& ) const;
00221 
00226     TiXmlElement* NextSiblingElement() const;
00227 
00232     TiXmlElement* NextSiblingElement( const std::string& ) const;
00233 
00235     TiXmlElement* FirstChildElement()   const;
00236     
00238     TiXmlElement* FirstChildElement( const std::string& value ) const;
00239 
00241     virtual int Type()  { return type; }
00242 
00246     TiXmlDocument* GetDocument() const;
00247 
00248     TiXmlDocument* ToDocument() const   { return ( type == DOCUMENT ) ? (TiXmlDocument*) this : 0; } 
00249     TiXmlElement*  ToElement() const    { return ( type == ELEMENT  ) ? (TiXmlElement*)  this : 0; } 
00250     TiXmlComment*  ToComment() const    { return ( type == COMMENT  ) ? (TiXmlComment*)  this : 0; } 
00251     TiXmlUnknown*  ToUnknown() const    { return ( type == UNKNOWN  ) ? (TiXmlUnknown*)  this : 0; } 
00252     TiXmlText*     ToText()    const    { return ( type == TEXT     ) ? (TiXmlText*)     this : 0; } 
00253     TiXmlDeclaration* ToDeclaration() const { return ( type == DECLARATION ) ? (TiXmlDeclaration*) this : 0; } 
00254 
00255     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const = 0;
00256 
00257   protected:
00258     TiXmlNode( NodeType type );
00259     virtual const char* Parse( const char* ) = 0;
00260 
00261     // The node is passed in by ownership. This object will delete it.
00262     TiXmlNode* LinkEndChild( TiXmlNode* addThis );
00263 
00264     // Figure out what is at *p, and parse it. Return a node if
00265     // successful, and update p.
00266     TiXmlNode* IdentifyAndParse( const char** p );
00267 
00268     void CopyToClone( TiXmlNode* target ) const { target->value = value; }
00269 
00270     TiXmlNode*      parent;     
00271     NodeType        type;
00272     
00273     TiXmlNode*      firstChild;
00274     TiXmlNode*      lastChild;
00275 
00276     std::string     value;
00277     
00278     TiXmlNode*      prev;
00279     TiXmlNode*      next;
00280 };

00292 class TiXmlAttribute : public TiXmlBase
00293 {
00294     friend class TiXmlAttributeSet;
00295 
00296   public:
00298     TiXmlAttribute() : prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00299 
00301     TiXmlAttribute( const std::string& _name, const std::string& _value )   : name( _name ), value( _value ), prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00302 
00303     const std::string& Name()  const { return name; }       
00304     const std::string& Value() const { return value; }      
00305 
00306     void SetName( const std::string& _name )    { name = _name; }       
00307     void SetValue( const std::string& _value )  { value = _value; }     
00308 
00310     TiXmlAttribute* Next();
00312     TiXmlAttribute* Previous();
00313 
00314     bool operator==( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs ) const { return rhs.name == name; }
00315     bool operator<( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name < rhs.name; }
00316     bool operator>( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name > rhs.name; }
00317 
00318     /*  [internal use] 
00319         Attribtue parsing starts: first letter of the name
00320                          returns: the next char after the value end quote
00321     */  
00322     const char* Parse( const char* );
00323 
00324     // [internal use] 
00325     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth );
00326 
00327     // [internal use]
00328     // Set the document pointer so the attribute can report errors.
00329     void SetDocument( TiXmlDocument* doc )  { document = doc; }
00330 
00331   private:
00332     TiXmlDocument*  document;   // A pointer back to a document, for error reporting.
00333     std::string     name;
00334     std::string     value;
00335 
00336     TiXmlAttribute* prev;
00337     TiXmlAttribute* next;
00338 };
00339 
00340 
00341 /*  A class used to manage a group of attributes.
00342     It is only used internally, both by the ELEMENT and the DECLARATION.
00343     
00344     The set can be changed transparent to the Element and Declaration
00345     classes that use it, but NOT transparent to the Attribute 
00346     which has to implement a next() and previous() method. Which makes
00347     it a bit problematic and prevents the use of STL.
00348 
00349     This version is implemented with circular lists because:
00350         - I like circular lists
00351         - it demonstrates some independence from the (typical) doubly linked list.
00352 */
00353 class TiXmlAttributeSet
00354 {
00355   public:
00356     TiXmlAttributeSet();
00357     ~TiXmlAttributeSet();
00358 
00359     void Add( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00360     void Remove( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00361 
00362     TiXmlAttribute* First() const   { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00363     TiXmlAttribute* Last()  const   { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00364     
00365     TiXmlAttribute* Find( const std::string& name ) const;
00366 
00367   private:
00368     TiXmlAttribute sentinel;
00369 };
00370

00376 class TiXmlElement : public TiXmlNode
00377 {
00378   public:
00380     TiXmlElement( const std::string& value );
00381 
00382     virtual ~TiXmlElement();
00383 
00387     const std::string* Attribute( const std::string& name ) const;
00388 
00392     const std::string* Attribute( const std::string& name, int* i ) const;
00393 
00397     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, 
00398                        const std::string& value );
00399 
00403     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, 
00404                        int value );
00405 
00408     void RemoveAttribute( const std::string& name );
00409 
00410     TiXmlAttribute* FirstAttribute()    { return attributeSet.First(); }        
00411     TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute()     { return attributeSet.Last(); }     
00412 
00413     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00414     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00415     // [internal use] 
00416     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth );
00417 
00418   protected:
00419     /*  [internal use] 
00420         Attribtue parsing starts: next char past '<'
00421                          returns: next char past '>'
00422     */  
00423     virtual const char* Parse( const char* );
00424     const char* ReadValue( const char* p );
00425 
00426   private:
00427     TiXmlAttributeSet attributeSet;
00428 };

00433 class TiXmlComment : public TiXmlNode
00434 {
00435   public:
00437     TiXmlComment() : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::COMMENT ) {}
00438     virtual ~TiXmlComment() {}
00439 
00440     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00441     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00442     // [internal use] 
00443     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth );
00444 
00445   protected:
00446     /*  [internal use] 
00447         Attribtue parsing starts: at the ! of the !--
00448                          returns: next char past '>'
00449     */  
00450     virtual const char* Parse( const char* );
00451 };

00456 class TiXmlText : public TiXmlNode
00457 {
00458   public:
00459     TiXmlText()  : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::TEXT ) {}
00460     virtual ~TiXmlText() {}
00461 
00462 
00463     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returns it.
00464     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00465     // [internal use] 
00466     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth );
00467     // [internal use]   
00468     bool Blank();   // returns true if all white space and new lines
00469 
00470     /*  [internal use] 
00471         Attribtue parsing starts: First char of the text
00472                          returns: next char past '>'
00473     */  
00474     virtual const char* Parse( const char* );
00475 };

00491 class TiXmlDeclaration : public TiXmlNode
00492 {
00493   public:
00495     TiXmlDeclaration()   : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::DECLARATION ) {}
00496 
00498     TiXmlDeclaration( const std::string& version, 
00499                       const std::string& encoding,
00500                       const std::string& standalone );
00501 
00502     virtual ~TiXmlDeclaration() {}
00503 
00505     const std::string& Version()        { return version; }
00507     const std::string& Encoding()       { return encoding; }
00509     const std::string& Standalone()     { return standalone; }
00510 
00511     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00512     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00513     // [internal use] 
00514     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth );
00515 
00516   protected:
00517     //  [internal use] 
00518     //  Attribtue parsing starts: next char past '<'
00519     //                   returns: next char past '>'
00520     
00521     virtual const char* Parse( const char* );
00522 
00523   private:
00524     std::string version;
00525     std::string encoding;
00526     std::string standalone;
00527 };

00535 class TiXmlUnknown : public TiXmlNode
00536 {
00537   public:
00538     TiXmlUnknown() : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::UNKNOWN ) {}
00539     virtual ~TiXmlUnknown() {}
00540 
00541     // [internal use]   
00542     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00543     // [internal use]   
00544     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth );
00545 
00546   protected:
00547     /*  [internal use] 
00548         Attribute parsing starts: First char of the text
00549                          returns: next char past '>'
00550     */  
00551     virtual const char* Parse( const char* );
00552 };

00559 class TiXmlDocument : public TiXmlNode
00560 {
00561   public:
00563     TiXmlDocument();
00565     TiXmlDocument( const std::string& documentName );
00566     
00567     virtual ~TiXmlDocument() {}
00568 
00570     bool LoadFile();
00572     bool SaveFile();
00574     bool LoadFile( const std::string& filename );
00576     bool SaveFile( const std::string& filename );
00577 
00579     const char* Parse( const char* );
00580     
00582     bool Error()                        { return error; }
00584     const std::string& ErrorDesc()      { return errorDesc; }
00585 
00587     virtual void Print( FILE* fp, int depth = 0 );
00589     void Print()                                        { Print( stdout, 0 ); }
00590   
00591     // [internal use]   
00592     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00593     // [internal use]   
00594     void SetError( int err ) {      assert( err > 0 && err < ERROR_STRING_COUNT );
00595                                     error   = true; 
00596                                     errorId = err;
00597                                     errorDesc = errorString[ errorId ]; }
00598 
00599   private:
00600     bool error;
00601     int  errorId;   
00602     std::string errorDesc;
00603 };
